text: Vibratome sections (250 μm thick) of the floor of the fourth ventricle of the brains of infant Wistar rats (between 9 and 15 days of age) were prepared to allow ependymal cilia to be viewed on an inverted microscope using a × 40 objective lens. Each section was submerged under 4 ml of media 199 (M199, Gibco, Invitrogen, Paisley, UK), as described previously [16] .
